alert.note: Alert for Grand (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 18 at 2:28PM MDT until further notice by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...RIVER FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT AND RESERVOIR RELEASES REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding caused by rain on snow accelerating snowmelt and controlled, reservoir releases continues. * WHERE...Portions of the Dolores River below the confluence of the San Miguel River to the confluence with the Colorado River. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying areas is possible. Expect high water levels and fast currents along the Dolores. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 225 PM MDT, Gage reports and forecast hydrographs indicate minor flooding is ongoing and expected to continue within the advisory area. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Dolores River and West Creek - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Gateway and sections along State Highway 141. - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: If you are in the advisory area, remain alert to possible flooding or the possibility of the advisory being upgraded to a warning. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
